1.1.Purpose: To assess both how frequently data is updated and how timely the data are. This is done by analysing financial transactions.
1.1.Scoring method: If on the last day of four of the past six months, the most recent transaction date in any activity is less than one month in arrears, 4 is scored. OR If less than a quarter in arrears 3 is scored, OR 2 if less than six months in arrears.
1.1.Notes(except where otherwise noted, a 95: Every night the Registry will trawl all registered datasets and stores the most recent transaction date on any activity. The end of month value is also stored for the past six months.

1.2.Purpose: To assess the provision of forward looking data on country-level budgets.
1.2.Scoring method: If country budgets exist for 50% of all countries in which the publisher reports activities: score 2 if budgets exist for the next two years or more; OR score 1 if budgets exist for the next year only.
1.2.Notes(except where otherwise noted, a 95: Total number of countries is calculated from publisher's reporting to the activity standard. Year is calculated from the date of assessment. 50% applied as donor may produce country budgets only for main partners

1.3.Purpose: To assess the provision of activity-level forward looking financial data.
1.3.Scoring method: Score 2 if 50% of current activities contain either budgets or planned disbursements covering a period beyond the current date.
1.3.Notes(except where otherwise noted, a 95: A current activity is calculated from the activity status or from the planned or actual end date. 50% applied as not all activities lend themselves to forward budgeting.

1.4.Purpose: To assess whether financial data can be aligned and incorporated into recipient country's fiscal year and planning cycles.
1.4.Scoring method: If financial transactions are aggregated no more than quarterly score 1 AND if budgets or planned disbursements are reported at least quarterly score 2 OR if reported annually score 1
1.4.Notes(except where otherwise noted, a 95: The only way to be sure that financial data can be aligned with most recipients' fiscal years and planning cycles is to provide no more than quarterly aggregations.

2.1.Purpose: To check that activities are defined by globally unique identifiers
2.1.Scoring method: Score 1 if 95% of activities contain an identifier AND that it is unique for the publisher
2.1.Notes(except where otherwise noted, a 95: Uniqueness is checked against all of a publisher's activities, not just a single file.

2.2.Purpose: To check that recipient countries are able to identify activities by their title or description in a language that they understand.
2.2.Scoring method: Score only those activities that take place in countries where the official language of the country is different from the publisher's default language. Score 1 if 50% of such activities contain a language attribute in the title or description that is different from the publisher's default language.
2.2.Notes(except where otherwise noted, a 95: Activities with multiple or no recipient country are excluded from the calculation, as are activities where the language of the publisher and the recipient is the same. Currently checks are made against English, French, Spanish and Portuguese only.

2.3.Scoring method: Score 1 if planned-start or actual-start activity date is present in 95% of activities

2.4.Scoring method: Score 1 if planned-end or actual-end activity date is present in 75% of activities
2.4.Notes(except where otherwise noted, a 95: 75% threshold to allow for pipeline and programme activities with no end date.

2.5.Purpose: To check information is provided on which organisation is implementing the activity
2.5.Scoring method: Score 1 if an implementing organisation is present in 50% of activities
2.5.Notes(except where otherwise noted, a 95: 50% threshold to allow for activities not requiring direct implementation

2.6.Purpose: To check information is provided on which organisation is accountable for the activity
2.6.Scoring method: Score 1 if an accountable organisation is present in 33% of activities
2.6.Notes(except where otherwise noted, a 95: Primarily required for on-budget activities. 33% threshold reflects this.

3.1.1.Purpose: To assess if information is provided on the sub-national geographical location of the activity
3.1.1.Scoring method: Score 2 if 50% of activities contain either geographical coordinates or administrative area information OR score 1 if 50% of activities contain free text location descriptions
3.1.1.Notes(except where otherwise noted, a 95: 50% threshold is to reflect that not all activities can be geo-coded and to encourage publishers to begin including location data where they can

3.1.2.Purpose: To assess if information is provided on the sub-national geographical location of the activity
3.1.2.Scoring method: Score 2 if 50% of activities contain either geographical coordinates or administrative area information OR score 1 if 50% of activities contain free text location descriptions
3.1.2.Notes(except where otherwise noted, a 95: 50% threshold is to reflect that not all activities can be geo-coded and to encourage publishers to begin including location data where they can

3.2.Purpose: To check if information is provided on the sector benefiting from the activity
3.2.Scoring method: Score 1 if 95% of activities contain CRS sector codes

4.1.Purpose: To check that the distinction between capital and recurrent expenditure can be made for budget planning purposes
4.1.Scoring method: Score 1 if 95% of activities contain economic classification element
4.1.Notes(except where otherwise noted, a 95: Item still to be agreed by IATI Steering Committee

4.2.Purpose: To check that the common code proxy for the budget classification exists which allows the alignment of all activities (both on and off-budget) with the budget planning purposes
4.2.Scoring method: Score 1 if 95% of activities contain the common code budget classification element
4.2.Notes(except where otherwise noted, a 95: Item still to be agreed by IATI Steering Committee

5.1.Purpose: To check that the total committed or planned cost of an activity is recorded
5.1.Scoring method: Score 1 if 95% of activities contain a transaction with type "Commitment"
5.1.Notes(except where otherwise noted, a 95: Commitments should not only be filled out by donors. Implementing agencies should report the total activity budget as a commitment.

5.2.Purpose: To check that disbursements and/or expenditures are being recorded at activity level
5.2.Scoring method: Score 1 if 75% of activities contain a transaction with type "Disbursement" or "Expenditure"
5.2.Notes(except where otherwise noted, a 95: 75% threshold allows for new activities which have not yet reported outgoings.

5.3.Purpose: To assess the ability of funds to be traced down the aid delivery chain
5.3.Scoring method: Score 2 if 75% of "Disbursement" and "Incoming Funds" transactions  contain information on a receiver organisation or  provider organisation respectively OR score only 1 if the above conditions are met in 50% of cases.
5.3.Notes(except where otherwise noted, a 95: Ideally the activity identifier of the respective provider or receiver organisation should be provided, but the indicator scores on any available information - even a name without an organisation identifier. 75% and 50% threshold to reflect that not all transactions will record these  data

6.1.Purpose: To check whether additional activity documentation is provided
6.1.Scoring method: Score 1 if 75% of activities contain a link to a published document OR a dedicated web page.
6.1.Notes(except where otherwise noted, a 95: 75% threshold to allow that documentation may not be published for smaller activities

6.2.Purpose: To check whether the terms of conditions are published where applicable.
6.2.Scoring method: Score 1 if 75% of activities that record that conditions are attached ALSO record the terms of the conditions OR record conditions attached as "No"
6.2.Notes(except where otherwise noted, a 95: If no conditions are attached publishers need to report this proactively as a "No". If the element is not reported publishers will not score on this, even if they do not apply any conditions. 75% threshold to encourage donors to start publishing conditions as text

6.3.1.Scoring method: Score 2 if 33% of activities contain a results indicator element OR score 1 if 33% of activities contain a populated results element without indicator details.
6.3.1.Notes(except where otherwise noted, a 95: 33% threshold is to encourage publishers to start reporting results where possible.

6.3.2.Scoring method: Score 2 if 33% of activities contain a results indicator element OR score 1 if 33% of activities contain a populated results element without indicator details.
6.3.2.Notes(except where otherwise noted, a 95: 33% threshold is to encourage publishers to start reporting results where possible.
